1.title: Remove the bandage
1.content: After 2–4 hours, remove all the bandage I so carefully applied to you after the session. Breathe easy, your tattoo wants some freedom too.

2.title: Wash your tattoo
2.content: Use warm water + antibacterial soap. Pat dry with a clean paper towel, don’t rub.

3.title: Apply cream
3.content: A thin layer is enough to let the tattoo breathe. Don’t drown it in cream.

4.title: Cover with a baby wrap
4.content: Use a fresh wrap + tape or bandage if you’re heading outside or going to bed. At home, you can skip the wrap but don’t forget to apply cream!

5.title: Change the wrap
5.content: For the next 3 days, you'll need to change your bandage every 3-4 hours following this routine. Commit to your tattoo and do it responsibly - it's worth it.

6.title: Let your tattoo breathe on day 4
6.content: No more wraps needed, but aftercare is still important 2–3 times a day (for 2–3 weeks). Care = perfect healing.

1.title: Peel of old film
1.content: You better peel off that film, I slapped on you, after the session (within 24h), especially if there's any gunky staff up under it.

2.title: Wash
2.content: Gently wash your tattoo (antibacterial soap + a clean towel - no shortcuts!).

3.title: A little bit alcohol
3.content: Before sticking on a new film, clean the area around the tattoo with alcohol (non-glycerin alcohol antiseptic). I wouldn’t recommend using whiskey or brandy for cleaning, but hey, if you’ve got some Isabella’s Islay whiskey to spare, that’d be a whole different story!

4.title: Fresh film
4.content: Slap on a fresh film and forget about your tattoo for the next 3-4 days.

5.title: Peel off
5.content: Then, remember it again, rip that film off (yeah, it'll hurt, but you'll survive).

6.title: Care after
6.content: Start slathering it with cream 2-3 times a day, for the next 2-3 weeks. No skipping, or your tattoo will hate you.

1.title: No tanning
1.content: Your tattoo is a vampire. Sunlight = enemy. UV rays will ruin the healing and the color

2.title: No swimming
2.content: Pools, hot tubs, the ocean? Nope. Full of bacteria, and your tattoo is an open wound

3.title: Don’t scratch or pick
3.content: Yes, it’ll itch. No, you can’t scratch. Let the scabs fall off naturally

4.title: Wear loose clothes
4.content: Stay comfy, and let your tattoo breathe.Tight clothes are its worst nightmare

5.title: No workouts
5.content: Sweat and heavy lifting can wait. Give your tattoo a break for a few days

1.title: What happens if you don’t change the wrap often enough:​​
inline-content: The wrap sticking to the tattoo
1.note: Conclusion: Changing the wrap every 4–6 hours isn’t just your artist’s whim — it’s the key to your tattoo healing beautifully and without any unpleasant surprises!

2.title: Do I need to keep my tattoo covered with a wrap?
2.content: For the first 3 days — absolutely! Going out without a wrap is like leaving the house without pants. At home, you can leave it open, but only if nothing touches your tattoo.

3.title: Can I take a shower?
3.content: Yes, but make it quick, like a firefighter on a mission. No steaming, scrubbing, or loofahs allowed. And baths, saunas, or pools? Forget them for 3 weeks — your tattoo won’t forgive you.

4.title: What if the wrap sticks to my tattoo?
4.content: No drama! Just wet it with warm water and gently remove it. Be kind — patience and care are your best tools here.

5.title: What should I do with the scabs?
5.content: Nothing. Seriously. Let them do their thing. Don’t pick, peel, or mess with them. Scabs know when it’s their time to go.

6.title: What if my tattoo itches?
6.content: That’s great! It means it’s healing. Wash it, apply cream, or give it a gentle pat. But no scratching, okay? Nails are your tattoo’s worst enemy.

7.title: Why are there red spots or fluid under the wrap?
7.content: Stay calm — it’s just lymph fluid. Wash the tattoo, apply cream, and put on a fresh wrap. Everything is going as it should.

1.title: What if I have an allergic reaction to the adhesive?​
1.content: If your skin starts rebelling against the film (itches, turns red, or looks annoyed)
inline-content: Stay calm, no panic! Gently remove the film under warm water — let it leave peacefully and painlessly.
Wash the tattoo with mild antibacterial soap and pat it dry with a clean paper towel — no rubbing!
Give your skin some time to breathe and relax
Start your regular aftercare routine: apply healing cream 2–3 times a day.
1.note: If the reaction gets out of hand and your skin keeps complaining — don’t play the hero. Reach out to me or head to a doctor. Don’t worry, it’s fixable!

2.title: I need to apply cream under the film?
2.content: Nope, everything’s already perfect under the film! Suprasorb creates its own “comfort zone” for healing, and cream would just ruin the vibe. You’ll need the cream only after the film comes off — let your tattoo breathe in peace for now

3.title: Why can’t I work out with the film on?
3.content: Sweat is no friend to your tattoo. All that moisture builds up under the film, turning it into a mini sauna, and trust me — your tattoo won’t enjoy that kind of “spa day.” It increases the risk of the film peeling off and slows down healing. Workouts can wait — your tattoo is the priority here!

4.title: Can I shower with the film?
4.content: Yes, but don’t scrub it with a sponge or expose it to hot steam.

5.title: What if there’s fluid or ink under the film?
5.content: That’s normal. If there’s too much, you can replace the film again.

6.title: How do I remove the film?
6.content: Under warm water, pull it parallel to the skin

cream-composition.title: Vesper Healin Daily Cream
cream-composition.description: A unique vitamin cream for fast healing of the skin in the presence of tattoo pigments. It reduces inflammation and itching of fresh tattoos.

specialFormula.title: Special Formula
specialFormula.details: The special formula for tattoo care in Vesper Healin Daily cream includes water, refined coconut oil, cetyl stearyl alcohol, d-panthenol (7%), PEG-40, soy wax, sesame oil, vegetable lanolin, glycerin, and preservatives that are absorbed by the skin for hydration and healing.
benefits: Provides effective healing from the first day after the tattoo session to the last day of skin regeneration.
Moisturizes the skin and keeps it toned for 4-5 hours, allowing less frequent application while maintaining constant hydration.
Non-greasy and does not contain petrolatum, unlike most creams.
Made entirely from natural and safe ingredients.
Easy and painless to apply evenly in a thin layer on damaged skin.

usage.title: How to use
usage.instructions: The primary name of the cream indicates its use throughout the day for maximum comfortable healing and maximum skin saturation to avoid skin tightness.

naturalHealing.title: Natural Healing
naturalHealing.content: DAILY CREAM allows tattoos to heal naturally but faster, relieving itching and the sensation of skin tightness.

seasonalUse.title: Seasonal Use
seasonalUse.content: The cream is indispensable in warm weather when using compresses may cause discomfort, and the protective film may weaken due to increased sweating.

storageConditions.title: Storage Conditions
storageConditions.content: Store at a temperature between +5°C and +25°C.
